full_text.full_text:
2. Similarity Coefficients (1/2)
▪ Similarity measures between objects that contain only binary 
attributes
– Typically have values between 0 and 1
• 0: the objects are not at all similar
• 1: the objects are completely similar
x = (1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 1) 
Similarity?
y = (0, 1, 0, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0)
▪ Notations
– Let x = (x1, x2, …, xn) and y = (y1, y2, …, yn) be two objects
• where xk and yk are binary attributes (k = 1, 2, …, n)
– f00 = the number of attributes where x is 0 and y is 0
– f01 = the number of attributes where x is 0 and y is 1
– f10 = the number of attributes where x is 1 and y is 0
– f11 = the number of attributes where x is 1 and y is 1
58

text.text:
▪ Similarity measures between objects that contain only binary 
attributes

• 0: the objects are not at all similar
• 1: the objects are completely similar
– Let x = (x1, x2, …, xn) and y = (y1, y2, …, yn) be two objects
• where xk and yk are binary attributes (k = 1, 2, …, n)

– f00 = the number of attributes where x is 0 and y is 0
– f01 = the number of attributes where x is 0 and y is 1
– f10 = the number of attributes where x is 1 and y is 0
– f11 = the number of attributes where x is 1 and y is 1
